pr_title: ISPN-12286 + ISPN-12357 Indexing configurations should not be inherited when explicitly disabled

timeline.message: ISPN-12286 Fix rather than delete some tests
ISPN-12286 Fix rather than delete some tests

timeline.bodyText: This addition ensures inheritance works properly when inheriting from an old base config that uses index`` or auto-configattributes rather thanenabled```.  Do you think it's worth adding this explanation in code @gustavonalle ?
timeline.author: anistor

timeline.bodyText: This should be done in the builder itself, in IndexingConfigurationBuilder#create(). The issue of doing here is it covers only XML parsing.
timeline.author: gustavonalle

replies.bodyText: indeed. but create() is too late because we cannot distinguish the inherited vs own. and we also don;t even have a ref to base config to try to figure out.
replies.author: anistor

replies.bodyText: what about resetting everything in the builder whenever the index.setDisabled() is called?
replies.author: gustavonalle

replies.bodyText:
I've pushed a new WIP commit to try that.
This thing gets disgustingly tangled 🐙
replies.author: anistor

timeline.bodyText: searchMapping is null well before this loop, so why not complain earlier about it @gustavonalle ?
timeline.author: anistor

replies.bodyText: I put it here so that it can report that a specific type is not indexed. Where do you suggest to move it?
replies.author: gustavonalle

replies.bodyText: a few lines above we have a check:  if (cfg.indexing().enabled())  so how can searchMapping be null then here?  it seems the only way (according to SerializationContextSearchMapping class) is if there are no indexed entities configured for a cache that is declared as indexed, and that is something we also catch earlier. So my question is when is this newly introduced CacheConfigurationException (typeNotIndexed) actually happening (which btw I think duplicates another message)?
replies.author: anistor

replies.bodyText:
if (cfg.indexing().enabled()) so how can searchMapping be null then here?

You can have an odd situation where the cache is indexed, but none of the entities are marked as indexed. This causes some issues, for e.g. https://issues.redhat.com/browse/ISPN-12218
I hope this validation will prevent it
replies.author: gustavonalle

replies.bodyText:
and that is something we also catch earlier

I don't remember seeing this being handled, and correctly reporting that 'entity X is not indexed' (this is an important part). Is that related to your changes?
replies.author: gustavonalle

replies.bodyText:
anyway, there's a test for this error reporting https://github.com/infinispan/infinispan/pull/8719/files#diff-b375b40160f198a071885221ebdbb838
If you move the searchmapping check, and the test still passes, good!
replies.author: gustavonalle

replies.bodyText: Looking deeper at this, the search mapping null check is wrong @gustavonalle . See the latest WIP commit I added and the commit comment.
replies.author: anistor

replies.bodyText: And I pushed another WIP, that fixes the issue.  After you have a quick look at it @gustavonalle I think I can squash those and merge this.
replies.author: anistor

replies.bodyText: Good catch @anistor let's wait for CI
replies.author: gustavonalle
